patterns.name: AWS Access Key ID
patterns.description: AWS Access Key IDs are used to authenticate with AWS services. If exposed, attackers can access your AWS resources.
patterns.fix: Remove the hardcoded key and use environment variables or AWS IAM roles instead.

patterns.name: AWS Secret Access Key
patterns.description: AWS Secret Access Keys provide full access to AWS services when combined with an Access Key ID.
patterns.fix: Remove the hardcoded secret and use environment variables, AWS Secrets Manager, or IAM roles.

patterns.name: GitHub Personal Access Token
patterns.description: GitHub Personal Access Tokens can be used to access repositories and perform actions on behalf of the user.
patterns.fix: Revoke this token immediately at github.com/settings/tokens and use environment variables for the new token.

patterns.name: GitHub OAuth Access Token
patterns.description: GitHub OAuth tokens provide access to GitHub resources on behalf of a user.
patterns.fix: Revoke this token and store new tokens in environment variables or a secrets manager.

patterns.name: GitHub User-to-Server Token
patterns.description: GitHub user-to-server tokens are used by GitHub Apps to access resources.
patterns.fix: Revoke this token and use secure token storage.

patterns.name: GitHub Server-to-Server Token
patterns.description: GitHub server-to-server tokens are used for GitHub App authentication.
patterns.fix: Revoke this token and implement proper secrets management.

patterns.name: GitHub Refresh Token
patterns.description: GitHub refresh tokens can be used to obtain new access tokens.
patterns.fix: Revoke this token and store refresh tokens securely.

patterns.name: GitLab Personal Access Token
patterns.description: GitLab Personal Access Tokens provide access to GitLab repositories and APIs.
patterns.fix: Revoke this token in GitLab settings and use environment variables.

patterns.name: Stripe Live Secret Key
patterns.description: Stripe live secret keys can be used to make charges and access customer payment data.
patterns.fix: Rotate this key immediately in the Stripe dashboard and use environment variables.

patterns.name: Stripe Live Publishable Key
patterns.description: Stripe publishable keys are meant to be public but should not be hardcoded for maintainability.
patterns.fix: Move to environment variables for easier key rotation.

patterns.name: Stripe Test Secret Key
patterns.description: Stripe test keys are for development but should still not be hardcoded.
patterns.fix: Use environment variables even for test keys.

patterns.name: Generic API Key
patterns.description: Hardcoded API keys can be extracted from source code and misused.
patterns.fix: Move API keys to environment variables or a secrets manager.

patterns.name: Generic Secret/Password
patterns.description: Hardcoded passwords and secrets pose a significant security risk if the code is exposed.
patterns.fix: Use environment variables, a secrets manager, or secure credential storage.

patterns.name: RSA Private Key
patterns.description: RSA private keys should never be stored in source code. They can be used for impersonation and decryption.
patterns.fix: Remove the private key from source code and store it securely (e.g., HSM, KMS, or secure file with restricted permissions).

patterns.name: DSA Private Key
patterns.description: DSA private keys should never be stored in source code.
patterns.fix: Remove the private key and store it in a secure location.

patterns.name: EC Private Key
patterns.description: EC (Elliptic Curve) private keys should never be stored in source code.
patterns.fix: Remove the private key and store it in a secure location.

patterns.name: OpenSSH Private Key
patterns.description: OpenSSH private keys can be used to access servers and should never be in source code.
patterns.fix: Remove the private key and never commit SSH keys to version control.

patterns.name: Generic Private Key
patterns.description: Private keys should never be stored in source code.
patterns.fix: Remove the private key and store it securely.

patterns.name: MongoDB Connection String
patterns.description: MongoDB connection strings with credentials can provide full database access.
patterns.fix: Use environment variables for connection strings and ensure credentials are not embedded.

patterns.name: PostgreSQL Connection String
patterns.description: PostgreSQL connection strings with credentials can provide full database access.
patterns.fix: Use environment variables for connection strings.

patterns.name: MySQL Connection String
patterns.description: MySQL connection strings with credentials can provide full database access.
patterns.fix: Use environment variables for connection strings.

patterns.name: Redis Connection String
patterns.description: Redis connection strings with passwords can provide access to cached data.
patterns.fix: Use environment variables for connection strings.

patterns.name: Slack Token
patterns.description: Slack tokens can be used to access workspaces, channels, and send messages.
patterns.fix: Revoke this token in Slack settings and use environment variables.

patterns.name: Slack Webhook URL
patterns.description: Slack webhook URLs can be used to post messages to channels.
patterns.fix: Store webhook URLs in environment variables.

patterns.name: Google API Key
patterns.description: Google API keys can be used to access Google Cloud services and may incur charges.
patterns.fix: Restrict the API key in Google Cloud Console and use environment variables.

patterns.name: Heroku API Key
patterns.description: Heroku API keys can be used to manage Heroku applications and resources.
patterns.fix: Regenerate the API key and use environment variables.

patterns.name: JSON Web Token
patterns.description: Hardcoded JWTs may contain sensitive claims and should not be in source code.
patterns.fix: Remove hardcoded JWTs and generate them dynamically.

patterns.name: OpenAI API Key
patterns.description: OpenAI API keys can incur significant charges if misused.
patterns.fix: Rotate this key in your OpenAI dashboard and use environment variables.

patterns.name: OpenAI Project API Key
patterns.description: OpenAI project API keys can incur significant charges if misused.
patterns.fix: Rotate this key in your OpenAI dashboard and use environment variables.
